name: Albino Burmese Python
description: A captive-bred color morph of the Burmese python with white or yellowish coloration and red or pink eyes due to lack of pigmentation.

classification.color_pattern: White or yellowish with patterns in yellow or golden hues
classification.distinct_feature: Lack of pigmentation, red or pink eyes

habitat: Tropical and subtropical forests, often near water
geographic_range: Native to Southeast Asia, found in the Philippines as pets or in captivity
behavior: Primarily nocturnal, excellent swimmers and climbers
diet: Mammals and birds, kills prey by constriction

name: Asian Sunbeam Snake
description: A glossy, iridescent snake with smooth scales that give it a distinctive rainbow sheen when light hits its body.

classification.color_pattern: Glossy black or dark brown with iridescent rainbow sheen
classification.distinct_feature: Highly iridescent scales, smooth appearance

habitat: Moist forests, agricultural areas, and near water bodies
diet: Small mammals, lizards, frogs, and other snakes

name: Banded Malaysian
description: A slender snake with distinctive white or yellow bands on a dark brown or black body.

classification.color_pattern: Dark brown or black with white or yellow bands
classification.distinct_feature: Enlarged teeth at front of mouth, flattened head

diet: Primarily geckos and skinks

name: Blue-Lipped Sea Krait
description: A highly venomous sea snake with distinctive blue lips and a banded pattern of black and blue-gray.

classification.color_pattern: Black bands alternating with blue-gray bands, blue lips
classification.distinct_feature: Flattened paddle-like tail for swimming, blue lips

behavior: Semi-aquatic, comes to land to rest and lay eggs
diet: Primarily eels and small fish

name: Blunthead Slug Snake
description: A slender, arboreal snake with a distinctive blunt head and large eyes, specialized for feeding on slugs and snails.

classification.color_pattern: Brown or gray with darker blotches or crossbands
classification.distinct_feature: Blunt head, large eyes, slender body

diet: Specialized diet of slugs and snails

name: Chinese Sea Krait
description: A venomous sea snake with distinctive black bands on a bluish-gray body and a flattened tail for swimming.

classification.color_pattern: Bluish-gray with black bands
classification.distinct_feature: Flattened paddle-like tail, broad black bands

behavior: Semi-aquatic, comes to land to rest and lay eggs
diet: Primarily eels and small fish

name: Common Mock Viper
description: A small snake that mimics the appearance of venomous vipers with its triangular head and aggressive display.

classification.color_pattern: Brown or gray with darker markings, often with a light line along the spine
classification.distinct_feature: Triangular head, vertical pupils, mimics true vipers

behavior: Primarily diurnal, terrestrial but can climb
diet: Lizards, frogs, and small mammals

name: Coral Snake
description: A group of venomous snakes with bright colored bands, typically red, yellow/white, and black.

classification.color_pattern: Bright bands of red, yellow/white, and black
classification.distinct_feature: Distinctive banded pattern, small head

behavior: Secretive, often burrowing underground or hiding under leaf litter
diet: Primarily other snakes, lizards, and small mammals

name: Dog-Toothed Cat Snake
description: A large, arboreal rear-fanged venomous snake with large teeth and vertical pupils.

classification.color_pattern: Light brown or gray with darker blotches or crossbands
classification.distinct_feature: Large head, vertical pupils, long and slender body

diet: Birds, bats, lizards, and small mammals

name: Gold-Ringed Cat Snake
description: A striking black snake with bright yellow bands, also known as the Mangrove Snake.

classification.color_pattern: Glossy black with bright yellow bands
classification.distinct_feature: Distinctive yellow rings/bands on black body

habitat: Mangrove forests, lowland forests, often near water
behavior: Nocturnal, arboreal, mildly aggressive when threatened
diet: Birds, lizards, frogs, and small mammals

name: Green Tree Python
description: A striking emerald green snake that spends most of its life in trees, known for its distinctive coiling posture.

classification.color_pattern: Bright emerald green, sometimes with white or yellow markings
classification.distinct_feature: Distinctive coiling posture on branches, heat-sensing pits

geographic_range: New Guinea, Indonesia, and Australia; found in the Philippines in captivity
diet: Small mammals and birds

name: King Cobra
description: The world's longest venomous snake, capable of raising its head high off the ground and flaring its distinctive hood.

classification.color_pattern: Olive-green, brown, or black, sometimes with yellow or white bands
classification.distinct_feature: Expandable hood, raised head posture when threatened

geographic_range: Southeast Asia including parts of the Philippines
behavior: Diurnal, terrestrial but can climb trees, builds nests for eggs
diet: Primarily other snakes, including venomous species

name: Marine File Snake
description: An aquatic snake with loose, baggy skin covered in small, rough scales that give it a file-like texture.

classification.color_pattern: Gray or brown with darker blotches or bands
classification.distinct_feature: Loose, baggy skin with rough, file-like scales

behavior: Fully aquatic, poor mobility on land
diet: Fish

name: Oriental Whipsnake
description: A slender, bright green tree snake with a pointed snout and horizontal pupils.

classification.color_pattern: Bright green, sometimes with white or yellow ventral scales
classification.distinct_feature: Very slender body, pointed snout, horizontal pupils

diet: Lizards, frogs, birds, and small mammals

name: Ornate Sea Snake
description: A venomous sea snake with a pattern of dark bands or blotches on a lighter background.

classification.color_pattern: Gray or olive with dark bands or rhomboidal markings
classification.distinct_feature: Flattened paddle-like tail, small head

diet: Fish, particularly eels

name: Painted Bronzeback
description: A slender, fast-moving tree snake with a bronze-colored back and blue flanks visible when the snake expands its body.

classification.color_pattern: Bronze or brown back with blue or turquoise flanks
classification.distinct_feature: Can expand body to reveal bright blue skin between scales

diet: Lizards, frogs, and small birds

name: Paradise Flying Snake
description: A colorful tree snake capable of gliding from tree to tree by flattening its body and making undulating movements in the air.

classification.color_pattern: Black with green, yellow, or red spots forming a pattern
classification.distinct_feature: Ability to glide through air, keeled scales

behavior: Diurnal, arboreal, capable of gliding flight
diet: Lizards, frogs, birds, and bats

name: Philippine Pit Viper
description: A venomous pit viper endemic to the Philippines with variable coloration, often green with yellow or red markings.

classification.color_pattern: Usually green with yellow or red spots or markings
classification.distinct_feature: Heat-sensing pit organs between eyes and nostrils, triangular head

diet: Small mammals, birds, lizards, and frogs

name: Philippine Shrub Snake
description: A small, slender snake endemic to the Philippines, typically found in shrubby vegetation.

classification.color_pattern: Brown or reddish-brown with darker markings
classification.distinct_feature: Slender body, smooth scales

diet: Small invertebrates, particularly insects

name: Red-Tailed Green Ratsnake
description: A large, bright green snake with a reddish tail and a pointed snout.

classification.color_pattern: Bright green body with reddish-brown tail
classification.distinct_feature: Pointed snout, red tail, large size

diet: Birds, bats, rodents, and lizards

name: Reticulated Python
description: One of the world's longest snakes with a complex geometric pattern resembling a net or reticulation.

classification.color_pattern: Complex geometric patterns of black, yellow, and brown
classification.distinct_feature: Net-like pattern, can reach enormous sizes

habitat: Rainforests, woodlands, grasslands, often near water
diet: Mammals and birds, kills prey by constriction

name: Samar Cobra
description: A venomous cobra species endemic to the Philippines, known for its hood and distinctive coloration.

classification.color_pattern: Variable, often yellowish, reddish, or brown with darker markings
classification.distinct_feature: Expandable hood, distinctive throat markings

habitat: Forests, agricultural areas, and near human settlements
geographic_range: Endemic to the Philippines, primarily in Visayas and Mindanao
behavior: Primarily terrestrial, active during day and night
diet: Small mammals, birds, frogs, and other snakes

name: Specklebelly Keelback
description: A mildly venomous water snake with keeled scales and speckled belly.

classification.color_pattern: Olive or brown with darker markings, speckled belly
classification.distinct_feature: Keeled scales, nuchal glands that secrete toxins

habitat: Forests and wetlands, often near water
diet: Frogs, fish, and occasionally small mammals

name: Yellow-Bellied Sea Snake
description: A highly venomous sea snake with a distinctive yellow belly and black back, the most widely distributed sea snake in the world.

classification.color_pattern: Black or dark brown upper body with bright yellow lower body
classification.distinct_feature: Flattened paddle-like tail, sharp contrast between dark back and yellow belly

geographic_range: Tropical and subtropical waters worldwide, including Philippine waters
diet: Small fish
